title: mCSCL Course for Supporting Emotional Regulation in Preservice Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: A short-term program for pre-service teachers to acquire emotional regulation skills in a collaborative learning environment with peers using smartphones. Development of emotion management strategies applicable to real educational settings through project-based assessment.

learning_goals: In an mCSCL (mobile Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environment, learners can accurately recognize their emotional states using emotion-tracking apps.
Using smartphone-based collaboration tools, learners can share emotions with peers and provide empathetic feedback with over 80% accuracy.
Through project deliverables, learners can present at least three emotion-regulation strategies applicable to scientific classroom situations.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
